Bulger wants to sequester jurors

Attorneys for James “Whitey” Bulger filed a motion late Sunday night to isolate the jury that will decide his fate when they begin deliberating if he is guilty of the sweeping racketeering indictment he faces.

4 out of 5 US adults struggle financially

A new survey found that many adults have faced joblessness and near-poverty or reliance on welfare, with hardship growing particularly among whites.
